papers.title: Chronic Critical Disease
papers.abstract: A clinical entity known as chronic critical illness syndrome appears in patients admitted to intensive care units for a long period of time, having survived an acute critical episode but failing to achieve clinical recovery. Its main feature is the presence of prolonged mechanical ventilation or tracheostomy, with inability to wean the patient from ventilatory support, along with other endocrine, immune, neuromuscular and cognitive disorders, and a state of persistent inflammation. This disorder has a big impact on the quality of life of patients and their families, and it significantly increases the annual costs of healthcare. We offer a review of the main clinical features of this syndrome.

papers.title: 以好带坏，治病之精髓；以坏带好，死亡之渐临
papers.abstract: 身体患病，通常是首先发生在某一部位，可以是很轻微的——如最早在脚趾缝隙出现的脚癣，（反映的是卫生习惯不好）；也可以是严重的损害，如脊椎病、糖尿病等-一旦发生意味着基本功能已经严重受损。

papers.title: Headaches and Facial Pain
papers.abstract: History: Obtaining a careful and thorough history of the headache is the most important part of the evaluation. You should establish the following as you are taking the history: Age at onset of headache. Onset of headache: whether it is acute, subacute, or chronic. Severity and frequency of the headache. Characteristics of the pain as described by the patient. Location and duration of the headache. Any associated symptoms or signs. What the aggravating or relieving factors are. Have there been any recent changes of headache type? Any relation to menstrual period or season? How often are medications used or how was the response to previous treatment?

papers.title: Prolonged Peritoneal Attack: A Rare but Crucial Clinical Presentation of Familial Mediterranean Fever
papers.abstract: Familial Mediterranean fever (FMF) presents with various symptoms. Episodic abdominal pain is one of the most prevalent clinical characteristics of FMF and usually improves within 24-48 hours. We encountered a 50-year-old male patient from Japan who experienced recurrent episodes (several episodes occurring per year) of abdominal pain with fever since his late 20s. The abdominal pain and fever began almost simultaneously in each episode. The abdominal pain typically lasted for 1-2 weeks, while the fever subsided within two days. He remained as immobile as possible because walking worsened the pain. MEditerranean FeVer (

papers.title: Fieberassoziierte Anfälle
papers.abstract: Fieberassoziierte Anfälle sind ein Phänomen, mit dem sowohl ambulant als auch klinisch tätige Kinderärzte oft konfrontiert werden. Während die betroffenen Familien oft in der Akutsituation extrem verunsichert sind, stellen die Anfälle zumeist harmlose Epiphänomene fieberhafter Infekte dar (Abb. [1]). Fieberkrämpfe sind mit einer Inzidenz von 2 – 5 % zwischen dem 6. Lebensmonat und dem vollendeten 6. Lebensjahr die häufigste Manifestationsform zerebraler Anfälle beim Kind. Es handelt sich dabei um altersabhängige Anfallsereignisse bei neurologisch gesunden Kindern, welche durch erhöhte Körpertemperaturen ausgelöst werden.

papers.title: Das schmerzhafte Schulterblattkrachen
papers.abstract: Während manche Menschen beim Vor- und Rückwärtsbewegen ihrer Schultern reibende oder knackende Geräusche ohne jede Beschwerden zeigen, gibt es einen krankhaften Zustand, den ich das schmerzhafte Schulterblattkrachen nenne. Von ihm allein ist hier die Rede. Über die Entstehung dieses unter Schmerzen auftretenden Phänomens sind viele Vermutungen geäußert worden. Ich verweise im einzelnen auf das Schrifttum. Einige haben Schleimbeutelerkrankungen, andere irgendeinen myositisch erkrankten Muskelstrang, wieder andere das von Gruber 1864 beschriebene erbsengroße Höckerchen oder Tuberculum am oberen inneren Schulterblattwinkel, das bei jeder dritten Person vorkommen soll, für das Geräusch verantwortlich gemacht. Doch sind alle diese Annahmen als nicht sehr wahrscheinlich anzusehen. In einigen Fällen sind wohl besondere anatomische Veränderungen, wie eine kartilaginäre Exostose an der costalen Seite des Schulterblattes (eigene Beobachtung, Abb. 57) oder eine Stufenbildung am medialen Schulterblattrand (Meyer-Wildiser-Aarau) oder eine plumpe Höckerbildung am oberen medialen Schulterblattwinkel bei einem Kohlenträger (Grashey) als Ursache des schmerzhaften Reibens anzusehen. Doch sind dies nur einzelne Vorkommnisse. Für das viel häufigere schmerzhafte Schulterkrachen, wo ähnliche Befunde fehlen, muß eine andere Deutung gesucht werden.

papers.title: Approach to the Patient with Fever: Acute Febrile Illness
papers.abstract: Abstract Acute febrile illnesses usually develop within a 24 h period, and either subside in a few days (e.g., viral upper respiratory tract infection [URI]) or, because of their severity or associated symptoms, lead to early medical evaluation and diagnosis. While any process that can cause fever may have an acute onset and could involve a wide variety of infectious, inflammatory, or other disorders (Chapter 10), the vast majority of acute febrile illnesses are due to infection (Table 47.1). Chronic febrile illnesses, i.e., those lasting several weeks, often have a subtle onset; they may be more difficult to diagnose, and when infectious that are most often caused by pathogens that are sheltered from host defenses (e.g., intracellular or in abscesses, bone, or endocardium).

papers.title: THE FEATURES OF PANIC ATTACK DIFFERENTAL DIAGNOSIS IN ADMISSION DEPARTMENT
papers.abstract: ВЕСТНИК СОВРЕМЕННОЙ КЛИНИЧЕСКОЙ МЕДИЦИНЫ 2018 Том 11, вып. 5 135 ОБЗОРЫ В ведение.Одной из основных причин много- кратных повторных обращений в отделение неотложной помощи являются панические атаки (ПА) [1].Пациенты с ПА в 4 раза чаще обращаются за медицинской помощью, при этом ежедневное среднее число госпитализованных больше, чем в общей популяции, на 29,4% [2].Сочетание четырех или более из 13 симптомов ПА (тахикардия, ощущение сердцебиения, «перебои» в работе сердца, потоотделение, дрожание или тремор, ощущение нехватки воздуха или одышки, чувство удушья, боль или дискомфорт в грудной клетке, тошнота или дискомфорт в животе, ощущение головокружения, неустойчивости или слабости, дереализация или деперсонализация, боязнь потерять контроль или сойти с ума, боязнь смерти, парестезии и приливы тепла) приводит к более чем 700 возможным вариантам клинической картины ПА [3], которые могут быть имитацией разнообразных соматических заболеваний, таких как острый инфаркт миокарда, тромбоэмболия легочной артерии, острое нарушение мозгового кровообращения, синдром раздраженного кишечника, эпилепсия, бронхиальная астма [4, 5, 6].Зачастую пациенты во время ПА обращаются к неврологам, кардиологам, гастроэнтерологам, пульмонологам, терапевтам и врачам общей практики, и именно с этого момента начинается «хождения по мукам», из кабинета в кабинет в поисках «серьезной», а на самом деле отсутствующей патологии.

papers.title: Kartagener syndrome: An unusual cause of respiratory distress in the newborn
papers.abstract: Kartagener Syndrome (KS) a rare genetic disorder belongs to a group of disorders referred to as primary ciliary dyskinesia (PCD) where the cilia covering the respiratory epithelium is either immotile or beat in an uncoordinated fashion. It is characterized by a triad of dextrocardia (with or without situs inversus), chronic sinusitis and bronchiectasis as a result of poor mucociliary clearance of mucus and bacteria. This may lead to respiratory distress in the newborn period.This is a case report of a 14-day old male who presented with respiratory distress (which was noticed soon afterbirth) and features suggestive of KS.KS should be suspected in neonates presenting with respiratory distress, pneumonia and no risk factors for infection.

papers.title: [Migraine or headache and oral contraceptives].
papers.abstract: 5 to 8% of women on oral contraception (OC) suffer from headaches or migraines. There is, for the moment, no serious pathogenic explanation of this phenomenon. Blood pressure and eyesight problems should be checked. Headache can at times be the sign of serious cerebro-vascular accidents; in such cases OC should be stopped immediately.

papers.title: Burning Mouth Syndrome: An Overview and Future Perspectives
papers.abstract: Burning Mouth Syndrome (BMS) is a complex chronic neuropathic orofacial pain disorder characterized by a generalized or localized intraoral burning, dysesthetic sensation or pain of the oral mucosa, recurring daily for more than 2 h per day for more than 3 months, without any evidence of specific mucosal lesions and/or laboratory findings [...]

papers.title: 내시경적 부비동 수술 시 항콜린성제제 사용이 수술 후 인후통 발생에 미치는 영향
papers.abstract: 수술 후 인후 합병증은 통증이나 구토에 비하면 사소한 합병증이지만 흔히 환자들이 불편을 호소한다. 양 측 내시경적 부비동 수술 후에 양 코를 막아 입으로 숨 쉬게 되어 구강 건조가 더 심할 것으로 보고 환자들을 glycopyrrolate를 전투약 하고 반전시에 쓴 경우, 전투약 하지 않고 반전에만 쓴 경우, 전투약에만 쓰고 반전은 atropine을 쓴 경우, 전투약 하지 않고 반전은 atropine으로 한 경우의 네 군으로 나누었다. 마취 종료 1시간, 6시간, 12시간, 24시간, 48시간 후의 인후통과 쉰 소리 여부를 묻고, 없는 경우 0, 있는 경우에는 감기 시 목 아픈 것 보다 약하면 1, 비슷하면 2, 더 심하면 3으로 하여 심각도를 나누어 물었다. 각 군 간의 인후통 발생률은 1군에서 조금 높았으나 유의한 차이가 없었다. 심각도는 모두 1이하로 낮았다. 쉰 소리는 모든 환자에서 발생하지 않았다. 양측 내시경적 부비동 수술 후 인후 합병증은 심각도가 낮고 24시간 내에 사라지는 것으로 항콜린성 제제 사용을 피해야 할 필요성은 없을 것으로 보인다. 【Background : After sinus surgery, airway dryness is made worse because patients breathe by mouth. Anticholinergic agents have antisialogogue effects. The airway dryness that occurs after surgery is severe and can increase the incidence of postoperative sore throat. Materials and Methods : One-hundered patients who were scheduled for endoscopic sinus surgery(ESS) were divided into four groups. Each group was premedicated with glycopyrrolate or had no premedication and reversed with glycopyrrolate or atropine. After the surgery the patients were asked about a sore throat and hoarseness postoperatively after 1h, 6h, 12h, 24h, and 48hours, respectively. Results : The incidence of postoperative sore throat and hoarseness was not significantly different among the four groups at any time. Conclusion : The severity of complications after ESS was low and subsided within 24 hours. Therefore, the use of anticholinergic agents does not need to be limited.】

papers.title: Long‐term recurrent, yet nonprogressive, pedal viral papillomas in a dog
papers.abstract: Résumé Les papillomes viraux développés sur le doigt d’un chien ont été retirés et ont récidivés à quatre reprises en deux ans. Malgré la « persistance » des papillomes, ils sont restés petits et confinés aux doigts, et n’ont pas disséminés ou ne se sont pas aggravés. Tous les papillomes persistants ne progressent pas, même si ils sont traités avec des traitements plus conservateurs.

papers.title: Calitatea vieţii şi patologia funcţională digestivă
papers.abstract: Symptoms such as bloating, flatulence or belching are common reasons for which patients come to the doctor or pharmacist and suggest the possible presence of a gastrointestinal tract disorder. Simethicone is a well-known substance, used for over 50 years in the clinical medical activity to treat unpleasant symptoms due to gas accumulation in the gastrointestinal tract. The use of simethicone is based on its surfactant properties. Simethicone is physiologically inert, it is not absorbed from the gastrointestinal tract, and does not interfere with gastric secretion or nutrient absorption.

papers.title: 08 / The most important cause of stridor in infants: A case of Laryngomalacia
papers.abstract: Background:Laryngomalacia is the most common congenital malformation of the larynx which causes stridor in infants.The stridor is inspiratory, musical, vibrating and usually develops first 10 days of life.Dyspnea with permanent and severe intercostal or xyphoid retraction, poor weight gain are the other symptoms (1).

papers.title: Effect of Epipharyngeal Abrasive Therapy on Long COVID with Chronic Epipharyngitis
papers.abstract: Post viral fatigue syndrome (PVFS) is a long-standing syndrome in which patients suffer from the following conditions: low-grade fever, headache, weakness, impaired thinking, and neuropsychiatric symptoms such as depression [1]. Particular signs, including respiratory distress, malaise, olfactory and taste disturbance, hair loss, headache, and poor concentration, may persist for several months or longer after COVID-19 infection; such manifestations are reported as long COVID (LC) [2].

papers.title: Unfallursache Uebermuedung. Auch auf dem Deutschen Verkehrsgerichtstag 2004 in Goslar diskutiert
papers.abstract: Das Problem der Uebermuedung ist ein vorrangiges Problem des gewerblichen Strassenverkehrs. Einschlafen am Steuer ist die haeufigste Ursache schwerer Verkehrsunfaelle auf Autobahnen. Die Ursachen der Muedigkeit beim Fahren liegen haeufig bei zu wenig Schlaf oder zu langen Fahrzeiten. Typische Einschlafunfaelle sind das Abkommen von der Fahrbahn ohne Bremsspur oder das verkehrsbedingt nicht erklaerbare Auffahren auf einen anderen Wagen. Die meisten Einschlafunfaelle geschehen in den Morgenstunden. Aufgrund ihres Schlafverhaltens sind junge Fahrer besonders nachts gefaehrdet, waehrend es bei aelteren Fahrern schon am fruehen Nachmittag haeufig zu Einschlafunfaellen kommt. In aller Regel weiss der muede Fahrer von seiner Muedigkeit und waere in der Lage, Vorsorge zu treffen, indem er zum Beispiel die Fahrt durch Pausen unterbricht oder erst am naechsten Tag fortsetzt. Berufskraftfahrer koennen haeufig selbst im Zustand erhoehter Muedigkeit noch sehr gut fahren, solange eine besondere Situation eintritt, die ihre Aufmerksamkeit verlangt. Immer gehen Symptome der Muedigkeit und Schlaefrigkeit dem tatsaechlichen Einschlafen voraus, entsprechende Unfaelle sind also durchaus vermeidbar. Insgesamt besteht bezueglich der Unfallursache Uebermuedung ein erheblicher Handlungsbedarf. Der Arbeitskreis II beim 42. Deutschen Verkehrsgerichtstag in Goslar hat deshalb acht Empfehlungen formuliert hinsichtlich Aufklaerung der Verkehrsteilnehmer (Unfallrisiko und Erkennen der Uebermuedung), wissenschaftlicher Forschung (Ursachen, Anzeichen und Feststellung von Uebermuedung), verkehrlicher Vorkehrungen (profilierte Fahrbahnmarkierungen, technische Warnsysteme) und effektiver Kontrollen (Lenk- und Ruhezeiten).

papers.title: Pneumonia de hipersensibilidade crônica: análise de oito casos e revisão da literatura
papers.abstract: A pneumonia de hipersensibilidade é uma doença de natureza imunológica secundária à inalação crônica de poeiras orgânicas ou químicas. O diagnóstico na sua fase crônica é difícil devido à apresentação clínica e radiológica semelhante à de outras doenças intersticiais, sendo freqüentemente necessária a realização de biópsia pulmonar para seu diagnóstico. Os autores revisam os casos confirmados nos últimos 11 anos, atendidos no Instituto de Doenças do Tórax/UFRJ. Foram encontrados nesse período oito casos confirmados por estudo histopatológico. Os sintomas preponderantes foram tosse e dispnéia. Todos apresentavam infiltrado intersticial no estudo radiológico e padrão restritivo funcional foi encontrado em cerca de 70% dos casos. Nos sete pacientes em que foi iniciado tratamento com corticosteróide, todos apresentaram melhora clínica, porém não houve correlação entre a resposta clínica e a evolução radiológica ou funcional. Uma vez diagnosticado, o paciente deve ser afastado da exposição, visto a possibilidade de evolução para fibrose pulmonar nos continuamente expostos.
authors: MARIA DE FATIMA DO AMPARO TEIXEIRA

papers.title: Nausea and Vomiting in the Pharmacy : gastrointestinal tract
papers.abstract: Nausea and vomiting are not diseases but are common symptoms that may be caused by a variety of physical and psychological conditions. Vomiting may be voluntary or involuntary, but is commonly an involuntary, uncontrollable reflex that expels the contents of the stomach through the mouth. Nausea is a term used to describe the uneasiness in the stomach that precedes vomiting, although the patient may experience nausea and not actually vomit. Dry heaves or retching is the movement of the stomach trying to vomit when there are no contents remaining, but the impulse to vomit is still present.
papers.venue: SA pharmacist's assistant/South African pharmacist's assistant

papers.title: V. Comorbidities in Elderly Patients with Asthma
papers.abstract: 高齢者喘息の併存症には，加齢や喘息と関連するさまざまな疾患が含まれる．併存症の多くは，呼吸器症状の悪化，生活の質（quality of life：QOL）の低下ならびに喘息コントロール状態の悪化を招く．近年の喘息死において，未だ高齢者が多くを占めることとの関連も示唆される．高齢者喘息においては，高齢者の特性を踏まえた吸入薬の選択，正しい吸入指導ならびにアドヒアランスの維持を重視した確実な喘息治療に加え，複数の併存症に対する適切な管理も必要である．

papers.title: COVID-19 und das olfaktorische System
papers.abstract: Eine COVID-19-Infektion führt häufig zu Riechstörungen bis hin zu einem vollständigen Geruchsverlust; so häufig, dass diese Symptome inzwischen zu den diagnostischen Kriterien zählen. Viele Patienten leiden auch noch mehrere Wochen nach der eigentlichen Erkrankung daran. In der Türkei wurde nun untersucht, ob strukturelle Veränderungen des olfaktorischen Systems eine Erklärung für diese persistierenden Dysfunktionen darstellen könnten.

papers.title: Omalizumab for previously treated chronic spontaneous urticaria
papers.abstract: Urticaria (also known as hives, welts or nettle rash) is a vascular reactioncharacterised by the transient appearance of raised, itchy lesions ('wheals')on the skin. It occurs when histamine and other chemicals are released from under the surface of the skin, causing tissues to swell. The lifetime prevalence of chronic urticaria in the UK is 0.5 1%, but approximately 15% of people experience urticaria at some time in their lives. For many people with urticaria, the cause of their condition is unknown. Individual wheals can change size rapidly and move around the skin, disappearing in one place and then reappearing somewhere else on the body. They generally appear on the skin for no longer than 24 hours; however, the condition may persist for several months. Angioedema (swelling of lips, hands and feet) may also be present. When symptoms are present for more than 6 weeks, the condition is considered to be chronic. Symptoms may persist for 3 5 years in approximately 50% of people, and for more than 10 years in 20% of people. Initial treatment of chronic spontaneous urticaria is a non-sedating H1- antihistamine (for example, cetirizine, levocetirizine, fexofenadine, loratadine, bilastine, desloratadine). Dose escalation of the antihistamine (2-fold and then 4-fold) may be required if the standard dose is ineffective. Subsequent treatment options for people whose condition does not respond to non- sedating antihistamines include leukotriene receptor antagonists, H2-receptor antagonists, immunosuppressant drugs (such as ciclosporin, mycophenolate mofetil and methotrexate) and tetrahydrofolate dehydrogenase inhibitors (such as dapsone). Oral corticosteroid pulses may be used to treat exacerbations.

papers.title: Hyperinflation due to Tonic Activity in Inspiratory Muscles
papers.abstract: Tonic activity in inspiratory muscles has been recorded in particular circumstances. This was observed not only in patients suffering from pulmonary diseases but also in healthy humans or animals.

papers.title: Adult-Onset Asthma
papers.abstract:
Asthma in adults is composed of a complex group of reversible airway disorders in contrast to childhood asthma that is largely allergic in nature.


Adult-onset asthma may be recently acquired in adulthood or represent various stages of long-standing disease. Atopic adults may carry the genotype of childhood asthma symptomatically into adulthood only to have the phenotype finally expressed because of a powerful trigger, e.g., specific aeroallergen(s) or infection.


Approximately 31 million Americans suffer from asthma. The majority of patients (71%) are adults, whereas fewer than 29% (8.9 million) are children less than 18 yr of age. More women than men are affected with severe adult-onset asthma. Estrogen replacement therapy, respiratory infection with Chlamydia or Mycoplasma, certain occupations, tobacco smoking, gastroesophageal reflux, obesity, and sleep disorders are important risk factors and comorbid conditions.


Asthma and active cigarette smoking interact to cause more severe symptoms, accelerated decline in lung function, and impaired short-term therapeutic response to corticosteroids (CSs).


Simple spirometry, e.g., forced expiratory volume in 1 s (FEV1) and forced vital capacity (FVC), detect expiratory flow limitations and lung volumes. Demonstration of reversible obstructive airways disease with spirometry after using albuterol or ipratropium in an adult older than 18 yr old does not alone diagnose adult-onset asthma. Methacholine challenge testing to exclude abnormal airway hyperresponsiveness is safe in adult-onset asthma patients with FEV1 greater than 70% predicted.


High doses of inhaled CSs should be avoided in adult-onset asthma, particularly in the elderly or those with late-onset asthma. The addition of long-acting β2-agonists or antileukotriene drugs is preferable to using high doses of inhaled CSs. All patients using β2-agonists should be monitored for adverse effects, including paradoxical bronchoconstriction.


Given their demonstrated benefit in conditions such as heart failure, coronary artery disease, and hypertension, cardioselective β1-blockers should not be withheld from adults with mild-moderate reversible airway disease.


Patient adherence with prescribed asthma therapy is poor, and it is clearly the overwhelming explanation for poor control of asthma in adults, leading to exacerbations and hospitalizations. Compared with younger hospitalized adults, older hospitalized adults had clear deficiencies, including lower use of peak flow meters and worse asthma self-management knowledge.


Factors independently associated with hospitalization included being female, nonwhite, less educated, and less physically healthy and more frequent asthma symptoms. Chronological age was not an independent risk for hospitalization. Appropriate care for older adults with asthma should address asthma symptoms as in children and younger adults.

papers.title: Vomiting and Haematemesis
papers.abstract: Vomiting is a reflex autonomic response to a wide range of stimuli. It may be provoked by irritation, inflammation, distension or compression of the gastrointestinal tract or of other abdominal viscera (Table 21.1) or be attributable to a variety of non-gastrointestinal disorders (Table 21.2). The vomiting centre in the medulla receives these stimuli and co-ordinates the response.

papers.title: Kawasaki Syndrome
papers.abstract: KS is a fascinating illness of childhood that has emerged over the last 30 years and is now recognized as the most common cause of acquired heart disease in children in the United States. It has a dramatic clinical presentation in most cases, but for a small number of cases that present with a more subtle disease there appears to be a greater risk of coronary artery complications. Progress has been made in the management of KS, but although the disease appears to be related to an infectious etiology, no infectious agent has been proven to be the cause. Finally, issues in long-term management and prognosis are yet to be clarified.

papers.title: A CASE OF SWOLLEN HANDS AND FEET SYNDROME BUT NOT LEPROSY; A DIAGNOSTIC CHALLENGE
papers.abstract: Polyarthritis in leprosy mainly manifests itself in the form of swollen hands and feet syndrome during lepra reactions or insidious-onset chronic symmetrical polyarthritis mimicking rheumatoid arthritis (RA). However, hereby I’m reporting a case in which a patient has swollen hands and feet syndrome but neither he is suffering from leprosy nor RA and asking what’s wrong with me?
papers.venue: Asian Journal of Pharmaceutical and Clinical Research

papers.title: 防治“成年鸡脑脊髓炎病”，切莫误诊
papers.abstract: 发病情况成年鸡脑脊髓炎病(AE)主要危害120-360日龄的产蛋鸡群。各龄鸡都有易感性．成年鸡呈隐性感染。发病期无明显的季节性，但以冬、春易流行。该病无明显的病态症状，以产蛋急剧下降为特征，死亡率不高。有极少数鸡出现神经症状．如头颤抖、转脖、运动共济失调，其它症状不明显．往往不能引起人们的注意，

papers.title: PHYSICAL THERAPY AND HYDROTHERAPY IN PATIENT DIAGNOSED WITH RHEUMATOID ARTHRITIS POST CHIKUNGUNYA
papers.abstract: Chikungunya is an arbovirus caused by the Chikungunya virus (CHIKV). The symptoms are acute onset fever, joint and muscle pain, headache, nausea and fatigue. These symptoms usually disappear after two weeks, but a percentage of patients has joint involvement for months. It is precisely in these cases that point to the relationship between chikungunya and rheumatoid arthritis (RA). The inflammatory stimulus caused by chikungunya can act as a trigger in people with genetic predisposition for the development of RA.

papers.title: Angina pectoris: words patients use and overlooked precipitating events.
papers.abstract: Routine questioning may be inadequate to identify angina pectoris or prolonged discomfort due to myocardial ischemia. The clinician must ask patients if they have had any unpleasant sensations in the chest, neck, throat, jaw, arms, elbow, wrist, or back that they have not noticed previously. Once the patient uses a word to describe the discomfort, the physician should use the same word and inquire about the duration of the discomfort and precipitating causes, including the less common and unusual ones discussed in this editorial.

papers.title: Keratoconus und dessen Behandlung mit Hornhautvernetzung und Kontaktlinsen: ein Überblick
papers.abstract: Keratoconus (KC) ist die häufigste primäre Ektasie der Hornhaut (HH). Die Erkrankung beginnt in der Regel zwischen dem 10. und 20. Lebensjahr, jedoch wurde auch früheres und späteres Auftreten beschrieben; er befällt beide Geschlechter und alle Ethnien. Das geschätzte Vorkommen beträgt 1:2000. Keratoconus-Befunde und -Symptome sind abhängig von der Erkrankungsschwere. Frühe Stadien können ohne sorgfältige Diagnostik unbemerkt bleiben. Die Erkrankungsprogression ist assoziiert mit Zunahme der Myopie und des Astigmatismus und Verlust an Sehschärfe infolge Irregularität der Hornhautoberfläche, welche mit Brille nicht kompensiert werden kann. Der Sehverlust entsteht hauptsächlich durch den irregulären Astigmatismus und erst sekundär infolge Hornhauttrübungen und -narben. Die zentrale Hornhaut- und Epithelverdünnung geht häufig der zentralen Ektasie voraus. In fortgeschrittenen Fällen ist oft eine bogen- oder ringförmige Linie um die Conus-Basis zu sehen (Fleischer-Ring), weitere Zeichen sind Vogt-Streifen, diese sind feine zentrale, vertikale Streifen in der Descemet-Membran. Ein wesentliches Kennzeichen des Keratoconus ist die Ausdünnung (verminderte Dicke) der zentralen Anteile der Hornhaut, die eine geringere biomechanische Stabilität verursacht. Durch diese kommt es in den verdünnten Bereichen durch den Augeninnendruck zur stärkeren Vorwölbung (Protrusion), was eine kegelförmige Kontur der betroffenen Hornhaut bewirkt. Die genauen Ursachen des Keratoconus sind derzeit noch nicht sicher bekannt. Neben der genetischen Prädisposition scheinen zusätzliche biomechanische und biochemische Faktoren für den Ausbruch der Erkrankung verantwortlich zu sein. Natürlich wäre es vielversprechend, das Fortschreiten des KC durch eine corneale crosslinking-Therapie zu verhindern. Die möglichen Komplikationen dieser Therapie werden besprochen. Solange mit Brillenkorrektur eine für den Patienten ausreichende Sehschärfe erreicht werden kann, sollte der Sehfehler mit Brille korrigiert werden; erst wenn das nicht mehr genügt, halten wir die Anpassung rigider Kontaktlinsen für indiziert. Der Artikel soll einen Überblick über die klinischen Kennzeichen, subjektive Auswirkungen, Diagnostik, Verlauf, Pathogenese und Therapie-Management mit Hornhautvernetzung und Kontaktlinsen geben.

papers.title: Effect of pregabalin for the treatment of chronic refractory cough
papers.abstract: Chronic refractory cough (CRC) is a common clinical problem which is more likely associated with some physical problems. Although many patients have received satisfactory treatment, there were still many patients suffered from long-term cough symptoms after standardized treatment.

papers.title: THERAPEUTIC SCHEME
papers.abstract: The procedure generally takes around 20 minutes, but may vary, depending on the treated area. Avoidance of sun exposure and smoking are recommended for the next 48 hours. There is no downtime or recovery time for this procedure (Figure 6.15). The patient will be back to regular activities immediately. This procedure can be carried out as a so-called 'lunch hour treatment'. Mild erythema (Figures 6.16-6.19), a slight itching/burning sensation 5 minutes after injections, and small hematomas are sometimes possible (Figures 6.20-6.22).

papers.title: Irritable bowel syndrome
papers.abstract: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is a chronic, relapsing, and often life-long disorder of no identifiable cause that affects the digestive system. It is known by a variety of names, including spastic colon, spastic colitis, mucous colitis, nervous diarrhoea and nervous bowel. It is the most commonly diagnosed gastrointestinal condition worldwide, affecting an estimated 10-20% of the general population, and is second only to the common cold as a cause of absence from work.

papers.title: Pulmonary Alterations in Chronic Liver Failure
papers.abstract: Chronic liver failure can have profound effects on the lungs. Hepatic dysfunction affects the process of breathing (when awake or during sleep), impairs lung mechanics, and may cause dramatic changes in pulmonary circulation. These pulmonary alterations commonly result in symptoms of fatigue (possibly related to sleep-related breathing abnormalities) and dyspnea which can significantly affect the quality of life in addition to direct consequences of chronic liver failure.

papers.title: Acute Airway Obstruction in Rheumatoid Arthritis
papers.abstract: Rheumatoid arthritis is cause of laryngeal stridor. This symptom may occur as a result of the upper airway edema or adduction defects of the vocal folds (with/without cricoarytenoid joint involvement). Others manifestations of this inflammatory disease in the laryngeal level are hoarseness, cough, respiratory distress, foreign body sensation, dysphagia or odynophagia

papers.title: THE TONGUE IN THE PRESENT INFLUENZA EPIDEMIC
papers.abstract:
To the Editor:

—My experience and observations have led me to the conclusion that there is much to be learned from inspection of the tongue, even at the first call, in a suspected case of influenza. Special reference to the tongue will disclose a series of almost remarkable phenomena, so uniform in appearance as to be pathognomonic of influenza and all but a positive factor in the chain of diagnostic symptoms (objective, of course). These symptoms appear early in the course of the disease, near the second or third day of the onset or within the limit of seventy-two hours. In no other disease does the tongue present such an appearance except in typhoid in the second or third week. The tongue is long, wide, thick, broad and flat, not curled as to its point or lateral edges. The edges are often tooth indented. Its color is of a characteristic
papers.venue: Journal of the American Medical Association

papers.title: Blood diseases in old age.
papers.abstract: There is an increased incidence of chronic disease in old age, and blood disorder is not uncommon. Some diseases are more frequent in the latter half of life, while others -- such as the hereditary disorders -- are rare and occur only in a mild degree. Diagnosis of blood disease is more difficult in the elderly because symptoms of anaemia such as weakness, shortness of breath and mental disorder are often attributed to old age.

papers.title: 女性围绝经期健康大讲堂（之三十九）——女性更年期常见病之十五——耳鸣（上）
papers.abstract: 耳鸣是指患者在没有任何外界声源条件下患者主观感觉听到声音。如感觉耳内有蝉鸣声、嗡嗡声、嘶嘶声、哗哗声、搏动声、噪杂声等单调或混杂的响声。耳鸣患者自觉耳内作响,轻者如飞蚊嗡嗡作响,间断发作,休息或治疗后好转,重者如蝉鸣,或如潮水的波涛声,持续不断,十分扰人。长期耳鸣的病人听力减退,进一步发展成为耳聋。

papers.title: Wie kündigt sich ein Infarkt an?
papers.abstract: Ob vorher Warnzeichen aufgetreten sind oder ob der Infarkt ohne jegliche Vorboten kommt — er macht sich fast immer als starker, anhaltender Schmerz hinter dem Brustbein bemerkbar, der weder durch Ruhigstellung noch durch bestimmte Bewegungen beeinflusst wird. Oft ist es ein Druckgefühl, das sich ständig steigert, manchmal ein Ziehen, Brennen. Häufig strahlt der Schmerz in die linke Schulter und den linken Arm aus; er kann jedoch auch in der Magengegend oder im Halsbereich, im Kiefer und im Nacken auftreten. Häufig wird er als vernichtend empfunden und löst Angst bis hin zur Todesangst aus.

papers.title: Non-allergic non-infectious perennial rhinitis. Pathogenesis and treatment
papers.abstract:
textabstractRhinitis is a very common disorder. Most people suffer from an infectious rhinitis at least
once a year. The symptoms usually disappear within a week. The patients with chronic
rhinitis pose a much greater problem. At least 10 % of general population are affected by
a chronic allergic or non-allergic non-infectious rhiilltis (l). The impact of nasal
complaints such as in rhinitis is often underestimated. Bousquet and Juniper demonstrated
that impact of disease on quality of life is greater in rhinitis than in asthma patients
(2-4). There is no generally accepted system for definition, classification and terminology
of rhinitis (5). A distinction can be made between rhinitis of known and unknown etiology.
Known causes for rhinitis can be subdivided in mechanical Jactors (e.g. septal deviation,
foreign body,), injections (viral, bacterial, fungal), miscellaneous causes (e.g. rhinitis
medicarnentosa, pregnancy, cystic fibrosis) and allergy. Syndromes of unknown etiology
include non-allergic non-infectious perennial rhinitis (NANIPER), nasal polyposis and nonallergic
rhinitis with eosinophilia (NARES).
The subject of this thesis is pathogenesis and treatment of NANIPER. As this teml
suggests disorder is diagnosed through exclusion of known causes for rhinitis.
Available studies are often difficult to compare. Different authors use different methods to
exclude the known causes. The patients are sometimes presented in a study as NANIPER
patients without further specification. The way in which an allergic pathogenesis is excluded
varies from skin prick tests, senllu testing for specific IgE, total IgE, nasal provocation tests
or a combination of these methods. To exclude infection some authors rely on history
(chronicity of illness, lack of purulent secretions and or classic symptoms of acute
rhinosinusitis), some rely on laboratory parameters (sedimentation rate, white blood cell
count, nasal smears), others use negative radiological findings (noffilal sinus X-ray or CATscan),
all with or without use of a nasal symptom score.

papers.title: Rocky Mountain spotted fever
papers.abstract: The clinical picture varies considerably. On the one extreme are ambulatory patients and abortive attacks and on the other fulminating infections with an early fatal termination. Most infections fall between these two extremes and are of more typical symptomatology, with the case fatality rate varying in different foci. Extremely mild attacks without rash presumably occur, but in such cases a specific diagnosis of spotted fever cannot be otherwise than presumptive. The usual ambulatory patient has a low fever, the rash is scanty and may be scattered or localized and the patient is not sufficiently ill to remain in bed. The duration is less than two weeks. Abortive attacks generally have a rather sudden stormy onset with a temperature as high as 104 F. and a pulse as high as 130; but the symptoms rapidly lessen in severity and the rash is more or less fleeting. Recovery is complete in from

papers.title: [Rhino-sinus manifestations of systemic diseases].
papers.abstract: Nasal and sinusal disorders are observed at the onset or during the evolution of systemic diseases especially during Wegener's granulomatosis and sarcoïdosis. Crusting rhinitis and chronic sinusitis are the most frequent manifestations. In front of these manifestations, the lack of predisposition and/or the resistance to treatment should suggest a systemic disease and may lead to an early diagnosis and appropriate treatment strategy.

papers.title: ALCOHOL OR NO ALCOHOL IN THE TREATMENT OF TYPHOID FEVER.
papers.abstract: There is no disease in the entire catalogue of human ailments that is of more concern to both the physician and the patient than that of typhoid fever. It attacks the young, the old, the rich, the poor, the high, the low, the monarch and the slave, and while the disease has a special fondness for certain ages and conditions yet none are exempt even after having once had an attack. It is found on the mountain top and in the valley, and an epidemic may begin on the mountain top and spend its force in the valley as was the case in the noted "Plymouth epidemic." It is both epidemic and endemic, and no physician who engages in the general practice of medicine will continue long ere he comes face to face with this dreaded destroyer of family ties and human comfort. The diagnosis and symptoms of the disease

papers.title: Cystic Fibrosis, Bronchiectasis, and Pleural Effusion
papers.abstract: Effective functioning of the respiratory system requires 1) normal central nervous system control, 2) intact neuromuscular transmission and bellows function, 3) patent airways, and 4) normal gas exchange at the alveolar-capillary level. Respiratory failure may be caused by dysfunction at any of these levels, resulting in failure of oxygenation (hypoxemic respiratory failure) or ventilation (hypercapnic respiratory failure).

papers.title: Recurrent urinary tract infection in women
papers.abstract:
A 23 year old female student complains of urinary frequency and pain on micturition. She has had similar episodes on four other occasions in the last six months. She wants to know what can be done now and how to prevent further infections.

Is it really a urinary tract infection? Differential diagnoses include common genital infections (such as sexually transmitted infections and Candida vulvovaginitis), non-infective cystitis (caused by nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs and other drugs), and urethral syndrome (a complex of symptoms that indicate a urinary tract infection but without an underlying infection).

Type of urinary tract infection Symptoms that indicate a lower urinary tract infection are discomfort on urination, increased frequency of urination, urgency, and a change in the smell of the urine. Symptoms that indicate an upper urinary tract infection are a high temperature, pain in …

papers.title: Prolonged and chronic cough
papers.abstract: Chronic cough is defined as a cough lasting longer than 8 weeks and in more than 95% of cases, diagnosis and treatment is successful. However, in clinical practice, some consider a cough lasting for more than 8 weeks to be too long (not actually true). Therefore, this chapter deals with the diagnosis and treatment of prolonged cough lasting 3 weeks or longer. It is important to remember that disorders causing chronic cough are also included (Fig. 4.1). Prolonged and chronic coughs are broadly divided into productive coughs (Table 2.1) and non-productive coughs (Table 2.2). For non-productive coughs, the presence or absence of an increase in cough reflex sensitivity is also listed. If a post-infectious cough or cough due to infection such as pertussis, C. pneumoniae, or Mycoplasma, does not improve with antimicrobial therapy and lasts more than 8 weeks, the infection is the likely trigger of the chronic cough. In these cases, indiscriminate use of antibiotics should not be continued. In general clinics without specialist facilities, pathophysiological diagnosis of disorders based on specialized studies is usually not possible. In these cases, evaluation should focus on identifying common disorders and providing specific and effective treatment, using available laboratory tests to aid in the diagnosis (Fig. 2.1). As shown in Figure 2.1, post-infectious cough is not considered in chronic cough. Pathophysiological diagnosis of common disorder associated with prolonged and chronic cough. GERD, gastro-esophageal reflux disease. In patients with prolonged non-productive coughs, important disorders in the differential diagnosis include cough-variant asthma, atopic cough, GERD and post-infectious cough. Among these disorders, cough reflex sensitivity is normal only in cough-variant asthma. Cough reflex sensitivity testing can be more readily performed than spirometry. A normal cough reflex sensitivity test is strongly suggestive of cough-variant asthma. In primary-care settings, specialized studies other than routine testing usually cannot be performed. Therapeutic diagnosis to identify common disorders and provide specific and effective treatment is appropriate (Fig. 2.2). However, because many coughs are self-limited or due to the placebo effect, this may not necessarily confirm a diagnosis. Therapeutic diagnosis of common disorder associated with prolonged and chronic cough. Table 2.3 lists common causes of prolonged and chronic cough in Japan that are discussed below. Note: Cough-predominant asthma. In 1979, Corrao et al.1 reported on a variant form of asthma with cough as the sole presenting symptom. Clinical features included a chronic cough without wheezing or dyspnoea, near normal pulmonary function but increased airway responsiveness, and relief of the cough with bronchodilators. This subtype of asthma, later named ‘cough-variant asthma’, is a common cause of chronic cough in Western countries2, 3 and Japan.4, 5 Coughing is usually worse at bedtime, late at night, and in the early morning. Exacerbating factors include upper respiratory infection, cold air, exercise, cigarette smoke and rainy weather. There is usually no or little sputum production. There are no symptoms or signs of wheezing, even on forced expiration (the presence of even mild wheezing excludes the diagnosis of cough-variant asthma). In adults, cough-variant asthma is more frequent in women,6-9 and in about 30% of adults, wheezing will develop with a transition to classic asthma.1, 2, 7 A type I allergic response to extrinsic antigens may play a role in at least some patients, but total IgE levels and the prevalence of specific IgE antibodies to common inhalant allergens is less than in classic asthma.9 However, worsening of symptoms during certain seasons is more common in cough-variant asthma than in classic asthma.9 Exacerbations during the autumn suggest an association with sensitization to house dust mite antigens.9 Pulmonary function testing often shows a normal FEV1 and PEF, but in the group as a whole, patients with cough-variant asthma have lower values than healthy persons8 or those with post-infectious cough. Slight diurnal variations in PEF and decreases in PEF with worsening cough are observed. Indices of peripheral airway obstruction such as MMF and V25 are often decreased.8 Improvement of cough with bronchodilators demonstrates that bronchoconstriction based on airway hyper responsiveness, albeit slight, are the cause of coughing. As compared with classic asthma, the degree of airway hyper responsiveness in cough-variant asthma is similar or less.1, 6, 8 In a study to distinguish airway sensitivity and airway reactivity, airway reactivity was less in children with cough-variant asthma than in those with asthma, but airway sensitivity was similar.10 Cough receptor sensitivity is increased in most disorders associated with chronic dry cough and probably plays a role in their pathogenesis. In cough-variant asthma and classic asthma, however, no definite conclusions have been reached about cough sensitivity. In classic asthma, an increase during acute exacerbations and antigen exposure11 and decrease with inhaled steroid treatment have been reported.12 On the other hand, an absence of changes even with antigen challenge testing13 and an increase in untreated asthmatic patients compared with healthy persons, with no change despite improved cough after treatment14 have also been described. In cough-variant asthma, no increase in cough sensitivity compared with healthy persons and absence of changes with treatment6 has been reported. However, there are also conflicting reports describing a decrease of cough sensitivity in parallel with improvement of cough after treatment.15-17 Inflammation in airways where cough receptors are located increases the cough reflex. In cough-variant asthma, eosinophils are increased in sputum, BAL fluid and bronchial mucosal tissue, and the magnitude of increase correlates with severity of disease.8 In biopsy specimens of central airway mucosa and BAL fluid from peripheral airways and lung parenchyma, the degree of eosinophilia is similar between classic asthma and cough-variant asthma, indicating no difference in the site of inflammation.8 Airway remodelling changes are also present.18, 19 This may be of pathophysiological significance, but may also be a consequence of long-term mechanical stimulation due to coughing.19 In addition, increased inflammatory mediators (e.g. histamine, prostaglandins D2 and E2 and leukotrienes C4, D4 and E4),20 increased expression of substance P,21 and decreased pH of airway lining fluid may play a role.3 Table 2.4 shows patient selection criteria for a clinical study, and Table 2.5 shows simplified diagnostic criteria for use in general clinical settings. Airway hyper responsiveness tests are only available in a limited number of facilities, and their sensitivity and specificity is not 100%.22 As bronchodilators (β2 agonists and theophyllines) are not effective in chronic cough except for cough-variant asthma, improvement of cough with this treatment is diagnostic of cough-variant asthma.22 Sputum eosinophilia suggests a diagnosis of cough-variant asthma but is also present in atopic cough and eosinophilic bronchitis, which should be considered in the differential diagnosis.23 (Please see other sections.) Some patients with cough-variant asthma eventually develop wheezing with a progression to classic asthma. Statistics from a previous period when inhaled steroids were not prevalently used suggested that the rate of progression was 30–40% in adults.1 Factors that predict the development of classic asthma include airway hypersensitivity7 or maximal airway response24 to methacholine, sputum eosinophilia25 and a failure in use of inhaled steroids.7, 26 Treatment of cough-variant asthma is essentially the same as in classic asthma. 3.1.6.1 Patients with intermittent cough. Bronchodilators (short-acting inhaled β2 agonists (e.g. Sultanol®, Meptin®) or theophyllines (e.g. Theodur®, Uniphyl®, Unicon®, Theolong®, Slo-bid®)) are used as needed. 3.1.6.2 Patients with persistent cough or an intermittent cough not controlled by the above therapy. The same degrees of eosinophilic inflammation and remodeling18 as in asthma8 are present, so an inhaled steroid (e.g. fluticasone propionate (Flutide®) 200–400 µg/day, budesonide (Pulmicort®) 400–800 µg/day, HFA-BDP (Qvar®) 200–400 µg/day, or higher doses) are to be prescribed soon after diagnosis. Early treatment may prevent the progression to asthma,7, 19 and inhaled steroids are the treatment of first choice in cough-variant asthma. If needed, a long-acting β2 agonist (e.g. Serevent®, Hoknalin®) or slow-release theophylline can be added. Double-blind, placebo-controlled studies have also reported effectiveness of antiallergy agents (histamine H1 antagonists (e.g. Azeptin®, Alesion®),15 leukotriene antagonists (e.g. Onon®, Acolate®, Kipres®, Singulair®)16, 27 and suplatast tosilate (IPD®).17 As the preventive effect on airway inflammation and remodelling of these agents has not been fully confirmed, they should ideally be used in combination with inhaled steroids at the moment. In patients who are not adherent to inhaled steroids, an antiallergy drug as mono-therapy may be considered. Case reports have also described effectiveness of other antiallergy agents. Treatment primarily with inhaled steroids rapidly improves cough in most patients, and a step down in therapy is possible, but as in classic asthma, symptoms (cough) often recur if treatment is discontinued.26 3.1.6.3 Patients with acute exacerbations or coughing induced by inhaled steroids (suggesting inadequate control). A short course of treatment with an oral steroid (e.g. prednisolone (Predonine®) 20–30 mg/day for 3–7 days) may be added. Note: Cough-predominant asthma. In so-called cough-predominant asthma, cough is the major symptom but mild wheezing is also present.28 The only difference between cough-predominant asthma and cough-variant asthma is the presence or absence of mild wheezing, but clinical manifestations, pathophysiology and treatment are similar. In clinical practice, these disorders need not be discriminated from each other. However, the concept of a single ‘asthmatic syndrome’,29 which includes not only cough-variant asthma but atopic cough and eosinophilic bronchitis, which have different pathophysiology and prognosis, may be misleading. Atopic cough is a new disorder whose pathogenesis has been investigated since first being reported in 1989 by Fujimura et al.6, 7, 30-36 An ‘atopic predisposition’ signifies a predisposition to past, present, or future development of an allergic disorder. It does not mean production of IgE antibodies in the more narrow sense. 3.2.2.1 Symptoms, age group, gender, time of cough episodes, triggers of cough episodes.29 A non-productive scratchy (tickle) cough in the throat (larynx and trachea) is the only symptom. Patients may feel like sputum is sticking in their throat. Patients of all ages seen by internal medicine may be affected, but the incidence is higher in women, especially middle-age women. Coughing is most frequent at bedtime, followed by late at night to early morning, upon awakening and early morning. Cough can be induced by many triggers, including cold air (air conditioners), warm air, conversation, talking on the phone, passive smoking, exercise and perfumes. 3.2.2.2 Atopic predisposition.30 Past medical and family history are often positive for atopic disorders other than asthma. Peripheral eosinophil counts, serum total IgE and specific IgE antibodies suggesting an atopic predisposition may be present, but using these alone for screening purposes is generally not useful. Table 2.6 compares the pathogenesis of atopic cough with asthma, cough-variant asthma and eosinophilic bronchitis without asthma.37 3.2.3.1 Physiological features. Airway reversibility with bronchodilators is the same as in normal controls.32 In other words, the tonus of bronchial smooth muscle is normal. There is also no increase in airway responsiveness.32 Diurnal variations in PEF are within normal limits. Cough reflex sensitivity is increased but becomes normal with treatment and improvement in cough.6 3.2.3.2 Pathological features. Eosinophils are present in induced sputum samples in 80–90% of patients.33 However, the number of eosinophils is less than in cough-variant asthma and asthma. Most patients have eosinophilic infiltration in the tracheal or bronchial submucosal tissue,34, 35 but the extent of infiltration is mild compared with cough-variant asthma and asthma.8 Analysis of BAL fluid shows the absence of eosinophila.34, 35 This suggests that in atopic cough, eosinophilic inflammation does not involve the peripheral airways, a finding quite different than in cough-variant asthma.8 Table 2.7 shows patient selection criteria for atopic cough in a clinical study, and Table 2.8 shows simplified diagnostic criteria for use in general clinical settings. In cough-variant asthma not treated with anti-inflammatory agents, about 30% of patients will eventually develop asthma within a few years, but asthma does not occur in patients with atopic cough.7 However, if treatment is discontinued once cough improves, nearly 50% of patients will have a recurrent cough within 4 years.7 Longitudinal decline in pulmonary function is similar to that in healthy individuals.36 There is no progression to COPD. Bronchodilators are ineffective, but histamine H1 antagonists (e.g. azelastine HCl (Azeptin®), epinastine HCl (Alesion®), cetirizine HCl (Zyrtec®), fexofenadine HCl (Allegra®), olopatadine HCl (Allelock®)) may be effective.38 However, the efficacy rate is about 60%, and for complete relief of cough, steroid treatment is often required. In cases of severe atopic cough, bronchial biopsy shows more intense eosinophilic infiltration than in milder cases.35 If severe cough makes treatment with inhaled steroids difficult, administration of oral steroids (e.g. Predonine® 20–30 mg/day) for 1–2 weeks, as in cough-variant asthma and asthma, can provide relief of cough. Eosinophilic bronchitis without asthma (EB) is ‘pathologically similar to asthma with eosinophilia in morning sputum samples, but is physiologically different from asthma without an increase in airway responsiveness.37 EB was not initially proposed as a distinct entity and aroused some controversy on the relation between eosinophilic airway inflammation and increased airway responsiveness. The effectiveness of bronchodilators in patients with cough as the only symptom has not been established, and some cases may overlap with cough-variant asthma (Fig. 2.3).39 Diagnosis of eosinophilic airway presenting with cough based on airway responsiveness and effects of bronchodilator therapy (cough-variant asthma, atopic cough, and eosinophilic bronchitis without asthma).41 There are no gender differences in incidence of EB, but details on the time and triggers of cough episodes are unclear. Cough was originally described as productive, but many patients have non-productive cough. Fifty-six per cent of patients have rhinitis (mainly allergic rhinitis),40 11% have peripheral eosinophilia, and 22% are positive for specific IgE antibodies.41 Improvement in pulmonary function (mainly FEV1) with inhaled β2 agonists (so-called airway reversibility) occurs in less than 12% of patients.41 The methacholine PC20-FEV1 in most cases is within normal limits (142 ± 119 mg/mL (mean ± SD); range: 4.8 to >256 mg/mL).41 Diurnal variation in PEF is 7.2 ± 5.9%, a value similar to that in cough-variant asthma. Cough reflex sensitivity is increased but may normalize after treatment.42 The pathogenesis of EB includes sputum eosinophilia, and eosinophilia is present in 100% of spontaneous or induced sputum samples. The degree of eosinophilia is similar to that in stable asthma43 but less than in acute attacks.37 Histopathological examination of biopsied bronchial mucosa reveals eosinophilic infiltration in the intraepithelium and subepithelial mucosa; subepithelial basement membrane thickening is also present. The severity of findings is similar to that in asthma.44 In addition, the extent of submucosal T lymphocyte, mast cell and macrophage infiltration is similar to that in asthma. The degree of BAL fluid eosinophilia is also similar to that in asthma patients.43, 44 Sinobronchial syndrome is characterized by chronic and recurrent neutrophilic infiltration of the upper and lower airways.45 Inflammation in the upper respiratory tract resembles that in rhinosinusitis. In the lower respiratory tract, inflammation is classified in three categories as chronic bronchitis, bronchiectasis and diffuse panbrochiolitis. SBS typically presents with a chronic productive cough and is important in the differential diagnosis of patients with chronic cough. The exact aetiology of SBS is unknown, but various disorders and conditions with impaired mucus ciliary clearance and immunodeficiency (e.g. primary ciliary dyskinesia, Ig deficiency) often present with clinical features of SBS. Thus, SBS is probably associated with some dysfunction of the airway defence mechanism. Table 2.9 lists the clinical features of SBS. In many cases, there is development or worsening of a productive cough after upper respiratory inflammation. Other sinusitis-like symptoms, including nasal discharge, postnasal drip and throat clearing, are common. Physical examination of the nose and throat may confirm a postnasal drip. Examination of sputum inflammatory cells reveals many neutrophils, and H. influenzae, Pneumococcus and M. catarrhalis are often isolated on sputum culture. Treatment for dry cough (e.g. central cough suppressants, bronchodilators, histamine H1 antagonists, inhaled steroids, histamine H2 antagonists, PPIs) is usually not effective in cough due to SBS. Stringent criteria for diagnosis of SBS requires demonstration of neutrophilic inflammation in both the upper airway (sinusitis) and lower airway. Table 2.10 shows diagnostic criteria for a clinical study, and Table 2.11 shows simplified diagnostic criteria for use in general clinical settings. Sinus imaging studies are useful to detect sinusitis. The presence of neutrophils in a nasal smear is important in confirming neutrophilic inflammation of the upper airway.46 Similarly, the presence of alveolar macrophages and many neutrophils in sputum is important in confirming neutrophilic inflammation of the lower airway.47, 48 In mild SBS with only scant production of serous or mucoid sputum, an expectorant (mucoregulatory/mucus normalizing) like l-carbocisteine (Mucodyne®) 1500 mg/day as mono-therapy may be effective, but treatment with a 14-member ring macrolide alone or in combination with an expectorant is more common. The 14-member ring macrolides have anti-inflammatory effects in a broad sense, including improvement of airway mucus/ciliary clearance,49, 50 inhibition of excess fluid and mucus secretion from airway epithelial cells,51, 52 and inhibition of neutrophil accumulation in airway mucosa.53 Specific 14-member ring macrolides and doses include erythromycin (Erythrocin®): 300–600 mg/day, clarithromycin (Clarith®, Klaricid®): 200–400 mg/day and roxithromycin (Rulid®): 150–300 mg/day for 2–12 weeks. In some cases, the 15-member ring macrolide azithromycin (Zithromac®) may be effective, but optimal dose and duration require further investigation. Adding a low dose of a quinolone to a macrolide antibiotic may reduce sputum volume in a shorter time,54 but indiscriminate use can induce the emergence of quinolone-resistant organisms. Therefore, quinolones should be limited to patients who fail to adequately respond to treatment with macrolides and expectorants. A respiratory quinolone such as levofloxacin (Cravit®), tosufloxacin (Ozex®), or gatifloxacin (Gatiflo®) can be prescribed at adequate doses for up to 2 weeks. Gastro-esophageal reflux (GER) is the regurgitation of harmful substances like gastric acid and pepsin from the stomach into the esophagus, and the symptoms and complications due to GER are called GERD. The occurrence of various respiratory tract complications due to GERD has long been known.55 One of the major respiratory tract complications due to GERD is chronic cough. In Western countries, GERD plays a role in 38–82% of patients with chronic cough.56-62 Two primary mechanisms are thought to be involved in cough due to GERD. One is the ‘reflex mechanism’, in which GER stimulates vagal nerve endings in the lower esophagus, with development of cough mediated through the vagal reflex.63 The other is the ‘micro aspiration mechanism’, in which GER causes micro aspiration of gastric contents into the trachea and bronchi, with development of cough due to direct stimulation of airway smooth muscle and irritant receptors.64 Another proposed mechanism is the ‘cough-reflux self-perpetuating cycle’, in which GER develops due to cough, which in turn then worsens coughing.65-69 Coughing due to GERD is usually chronic, with a mean duration of 13–58 months.56, 60, 70 Some patients have symptoms of GER such as heartburn that precede cough. In other patients, only cough is present, without other GER symptoms.56, 60, 70 In suspected cases of cough due to GERD, conventional treatment for cough (e.g. central cough suppressants, bronchodilators, histamine H1 antagonists, inhaled steroids, antibiotics) is not effective. In addition, the medical history, physical examination, CXR, sinus X-rays, pulmonary function tests, airway responsiveness tests and PEF monitoring may not suggest any cause. In general clinical practice, patients with suspected cough due to GERD can be treated with a histamine H2 antagonist or PPI. A response to treatment suggests a clinical diagnosis of GERD-related cough.65 To confirm a diagnosis of GERD-related cough, 24-h esophageal pH monitoring is recommended.71 In general, esophageal pH is less than 4 in GER, and if cough develops with an esophageal pH of 4 or less, cough due to GERD is likely. If treatment with a PPI improves the GER and cough, the diagnosis is confirmed72 (Fig. 2.4). As compared with 24-h esophageal pH monitoring, the detection sensitivity of upper GI endoscopy for GER is lower, but endoscopy is still recommended to exclude, for example, obstruction due to esophageal cancer, achalasia, or Barrett’s esophagus. Table 2.12 shows patient selection criteria for GERD-related cough in a clinical study, and Table 2.13 shows simplified diagnostic criteria for use in general clinical settings. Results of 24-h esophageal pH monitoring in cough due to gastro-esophageal reflux. (a) Cough develop with esophageal pH below 4 due to gastro-esophageal reflux, and (b) administration of a proton pump inhibitor maintains esophageal pH above 4, with a resolution of cough.72 The cornerstone of treatment for GERD is pharmacotherapy. Treatment that includes a histamine H2 antagonist is effective in 80–100% of cases, but long-term administration is required to improve cough (mean: 161–179 days).65 With a PPI, cough may improve in as little as 2 weeks,68, 73 but the recommended duration of treatment is at least 4 weeks. In patients who fail to respond to a histamine H2 antagonist or PPI, surgical fundoplication is effective in 86–100% of cases.74, 75 Angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors are widely prescribed as first-line treatment in hypertension. ACE inhibitors are excellent in terms of cardio-protective, reno-protective and minimal effects on glucose and lipid metabolism, but dry cough is a common adverse reaction. The incidence of cough varies with the type of ACE inhibitor but is not related to dose.76 The incidence of cough is 10–30% and tends to be higher in middle-age women.65 The mechanism of cough is as follows. ACE inhibitors block kininase II and NEP, which are enzymes involved in bradykinin and substance P degradation. The local increase in bradykinin and substance P concentrations stimulate C-fibres, cough receptors.77 In addition, ACE inhibitors block the degradation of prostaglandins, which may stimulate C-fibres and induce cough. Angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor-related cough is usually a persistent dry cough that begins a few weeks after, rather than right after, starting therapy. Bronchodilators and central cough suppressants have no effect. Most patients are unaware that their antihypertensive drug may be the cause of coughing. Therefore, a detailed medical history and review of records is essential regarding use of ACE inhibitors. Another important point is that some patients without a cough while initially on an ACE inhibitor can later develop a persistent cough that is first triggered, for example, by a common cold. Cough usually resolves within 1 week after discontinuing ACE inhibitors. If an ACE inhibitor cannot be safely discontinued, consideration should be given to switching to an angiotensin II receptor antagonist, which does not induce cough. The conventional definition of chronic bronchitis is ‘a condition with chronic cough and sputum production due to chronic airway inflammation, associated with smoking and air pollution, not due to another cardiopulmonary or ENT cause, with symptoms on most days for 3 months during 2 consecutive years’.78 In many countries including Japan, however, air pollution is decreasing, and chronic bronchitis more often refers to ‘simple chronic bronchitis’ due to smoking, but without airway obstruction; in other words, ‘smoker’s bronchitis’. In addition, the period of ‘3 months in 2 consecutive years’ was established in the 1960s as social diagnostic criteria in connection with compensation benefits to mail carriers in London who suffered from respiratory symptoms due to smog. However, there was no good medical justification. Therefore, the period of ‘3 months in 2 consecutive years’ is no longer strictly adhered to in diagnosing chronic bronchitis. At present, the three important diagnostic criteria for chronic bronchitis are: (1) current smoker; (2) productive cough; and (3) improvement with cessation of smoking (Table 2.14). The cornerstone of treatment of cough in chronic bronchitis is smoking cessation. Cough resolves or improves in 90% or more of patients who quit smoking, and in more than 50%, the cough resolves within 1 month.79 If cough, sputum production or dyspnoea continue after smoking is stopped, treatment with anticholinergic drugs, bronchodilators (e.g. β2 agonists) and expectorants may be indicated. Cough in postnasal drip is productive. Causes of postnasal drip include sinusitis, acute rhinitis, allergic rhinitis and vasomotor rhinitis. In Western countries, postnasal drip syndrome is one of the major causes of chronic cough of unknown aetiology, and Irwin et al. reported that postnasal drip was the cause in 41% of cases.80 In Japan, 80–84% of patients with sinusitis have postnasal drip, and of these, 28–41% also have a cough. The mechanism of cough involves (i) acute and chronic laryngitis and bronchitis due to postnasal drip; and (ii) direct chemical and physical stimulation of cough receptors in the larynx and trachea by postnasal drip. Use of a tongue depressor and visualization of the posterior wall of the oropharynx, or examination by posterior rhinoscopy, will confirm the presence of postnasal drip. The diagnosis of postnasal drip can also be made by nasopharyngeal fibroscopy. Sinus X-rays and CT are useful in diagnosing sinusitis.81 On cytological examination of nasal discharge, a predominance of neutrophils suggests infectious sinusitis, whereas a predominance of eosinophils suggests allergic rhinitis. Treatment is directed at the underlying cause. The use of macrolide antibiotics in chronic sinusitis, or antiallergy and antihistamine drugs in allergic rhinitis, resolves or improves the postnasal drip and cough. Persistent dry cough after an upper respiratory infection, usually a viral infection, is common in middle-age and older adults, especially women.82 In 1998, an ACCP consensus report stated that 11–25% of chronic coughs were post-infectious cough.65 Furthermore, during outbreaks of Mycoplasma and pertussis, this rate increased to 25–50%.65 The mechanism of post-infectious cough is not well understood. However, clinical and experiment studies have reported a decrease in NEP activity (a substance P degradation enzyme) and histamine degradation enzyme activity.83 The diagnosis of post-infectious cough is clinical, including: (i) a previous common cold and (ii) exclusion of another cause of chronic cough. In most cases, the cough improves spontaneously. If the cough is prolonged, evaluation for another cause of chronic cough such as bronchial asthma or postnasal drip is recommended. Psychogenic cough, also known as habitual cough, was first reported in Western countries in the 1960s.84 The cough is often triggered by a common cold, with repetitive episodes, like a dog barking or a foghorn. The cough is loud, but not serious, and usually disappears during sleep. Even though coughing may interfere with daily and work activities, there is often some other ‘secondary gain’.65 Psychogenic cough occurs mostly in children and adolescents, with a slightly greater incidence in boys. Although rare in adults, it occurs more in women. The diagnosis of psychogenic cough is one of exclusion, after ruling out an organic or functional cause of cough. Antitussives are usually ineffective. Psychiatric referral is often necessary, including treatment with minor tranquilizers, support and encouragement, behaviour modification, psychotherapy, counselling and hypnosis. Chronic cough is considered a common symptom in lung cancer, but in actuality, only 0–2% of patients with lung cancer present with chronic cough as their only symptom.76 The mechanism of cough is probably stimulation of cough receptors in the bronchial lumen. In lung cancer patients without cough, the tumours are often located peripherally, where there are few cough receptors.81 In addition, many lung cancer patients are smokers, and some experts believe that cough is due mainly to chronic bronchitis associated with smoking. CXR is performed in suspected lung cancer, but care should be taken, because abnormal findings may be absent in patients with central airway tumours or those near the mediastinum. In smokers with refractory cough, sputum cytology and bronchoscopy should be performed. In goblet cell type carcinoma, excessive mucin production and bronchorrhoea may cause severe coughing. Tracheobronchial tuberculosis usually presents with severe cough and wheezing. Other symptoms may include hoarseness, dyspnoea and bloody sputum. As compared with pulmonary tuberculosis, tracheobronchial tuberculosis is more common in younger people, with a two to three times higher incidence in women than in men. In patients evaluated for refractory cough but normal findings on CXR, tracheobronchial tuberculosis should always be kept in mind. The mechanism of infection may include (i) direct infection of the bronchial mucosa; (ii) direct spread from a pulmonary lesion; (iii) bronchial perforation by adjacent lymph nodes; and (iv) haematogenous spread. In cases where M. tuberculosis cannot be identified by sputum smears and cultures, bronchoscopy should be performed, with examination of sputum aspirates for M. tuberculosis or histopathological examination of biopsy specimens for necrosis and epithelioid cell granulomas. The three cardinal symptoms of a foreign body in the airway are (i) cough; (ii) wheezing; and (iii) dyspnoea. Airway foreign bodies in young children often include peanuts, almonds and beans, whereas in adults, dentures and crowns are more common. In a study of 25 patients with refractory cough for at least 3 weeks, a normal CXR and pulmonary function tests, and no improvement with empirical therapy, bronchoscopy revealed abnormal findings in eight patients, including two with broncholiths.85 A thorough medical history is essential in diagnosing an airway foreign body. An opaque foreign body is easy to identify on X-ray, but a non-opaque foreign body is difficult to detect. Decreased breath sounds or wheezing on physical examination may help in diagnosis. Bronchoscopy is often required to remove airway foreign bodies. Interstitial lung disease is characterized by inflammatory and fibrotic lesions of the lung interstitium. The lesions are varied, and almost 130 such disorders have been identified. This includes interstitial pneumonitis, in which patients with acute and chronic disease often have a chief complaint of dry cough; cough is present in 50–70% of cases. Cough in interstitial lung disease typically occurs with deep inspiration or changes in body position. The mechanism of cough is thought to involve stimulation of peripheral airway cough receptors or alveolar stretch receptors, but the details remain unknown. Interstitial lung disease is relatively easy to diagnose by CXR, CT and pulmonary function testing. Treatment of cough is aimed at the underlying disease, but interstitial lung disease is often refractory to treatment. Bronchorrhoea refers to copious secretion of serous sputum greater than 100 mL/day. Bronchorrhoea has been reported in bronchial asthma, goblet cell type carcinomas, bronchial tuberculosis and idiopathic disorders, with a higher incidence in the first two disorders. The sputum has an egg-white appearance, is foamy with low viscosity, and is easily separated into gel and sol layers. Patients with bronchorrhoea have severe cough with copious sputum, and activities of daily living are impaired due to airway obstruction. The mechanism of excessive secretion in bronchial asthma includes: (i) fluid secretion from airway epithelial cells associated with active ion transport; (ii) mucin secretion from goblet cells and bronchial gland cells; and (iii) effusion of serous fluid due to increased vascular permeability. Bronchorrhoea is not a diagnosis but a symptom, and treatment of the underlying disorder is important, including reduction of sputum production. Chronic cough is a symptom in many types of respiratory disorders. These include pertussis, Mycoplasma pneumonia, Chlamydial pneumonia and bronchial tuberculosis, but in patients with chronic cough lasting 8 weeks or longer, eradication of pathogens with antibiotic treatment is a reasonable assumption. Of course, lack of a diagnosis and no appropriate treatment, or a mistaken diagnosis and ineffective treatment, does occur in some cases, but in patients with a correct diagnosis who receive antimicrobial therapy, the infection should be completely eradicated by 8 weeks. However, even with a correct diagnosis and appropriate treatment, cough can persist in some cases. Despite resolution of generalized symptoms such as fever and improvement of X-ray findings and inflammatory parameters, the cough may linger. This is particularly true in pertussis and Mycoplasma pneumonia. In these types of cases, long-term indiscriminate use of antibiotics sometimes occurs. When cough is the only lingering symptom after pertussis or Mycoplasma pneumonia, a secondary cause other than the pathogen, for example, an immunocompromised state, should be suspected. There are conflicting reports on whether cough sensitivity and airway responsiveness are increased in pertussis and Mycoplasma pneumonia.86, 87 Continued cough, however, may be caused by non-specific allergic inflammation of the airways, or by increased mucous production despite a decreased inflammatory response to the pathogen. In patients in whom cough becomes chronic. further evaluation for another cause is appropriate. Antibiotics are no longer effective, and long-term indiscriminate use is not recommended.

papers.title: 函授学练“昆仑瑜伽”治好我的“慢性气管炎”
papers.abstract: 我今年60岁，平素体弱多病，免疫功能差，经常感冒，由此而常引发支气管炎，久之发展至慢性支气管炎。发病数十年，并已影响到了心脏，使我痛苦不堪。每次感冒，气管炎发病都如临大敌，打针吃药也总要二十多天至一个月方能暂愈。除此，我还患有糜烂型食道炎等慢性病，饮食睡眠也长年不佳，长期在疾病的折磨中，似有度日如年的感觉。

papers.title: Kounis syndrome: A rare case of allergic angina secondary to loxoscelism
papers.abstract: Kounis syndrome or allergic angina is characterized by a sudden transient or permanent myocardial dysfunction caused by inflammatory mediators such as histamine, leukotrienes, platelet-activating factor, neutral proteases, and a number of cytokines and chemokines. Herein, we discuss a case of Kounis syndrome, which was brought on by loxoscelism.

papers.title: Long-term follow-up after otitis media in childhood
papers.abstract: Popular Abstract in Swedish Bakgrund: Oroninflammation ar vanligt forekommande i barnaaren. De flesta barn har haft minst en episod med akut varig oroninflammation (AOM) och/eller en period med vatska i mellanorat (SOM) fore skolstart. De flesta far enstaka episoder, frekvensen av AOM avtar i 2-ars aldern och frekvensen av SOM avtar fore skolstart. Efter en AOM episod ar det vanligt att man under kortare eller langre tid har kvar vatska i mellanorat. En del barn far upprepade AOM och/eller langdragna och recidiverande perioder med SOM. Detta behandlas med ventilation av mellanorat genom att ett litet plastror placeras tvars genom trumhinnan. Forloppet och eventuella komplikationer efter upprepade och langdragna oroninflammationer ar inte tillrackligt kartlagda. Patienter: AOM: Barn med recidiverande AOM (rAOM) fore 3 ars alder (= minst 6 AOM under loppet av en 12-manaders period) jamfordes med barn som inte haft nagon AOM fore 3 ars alder. Bada grupperna tillhorde en skara barn som tidigare har foljts noggrant fran fodseln fram till 3 ars alder med avseende pa bl.a. ovre luftvagsinfektioner och AOM. SOM: Alla patienter som under 1980-talet behandlades for langdragen SOM av en av klinikens specialister registrerades lopande. De patienter som hade kontinuerlig mellanorevatska i minst 6 ar i varje ora, endast avbrutet av perioder med ventilationsror genom trumhinnan, utgjorde SOM patienterna (52 personer). De jamfordes med en grupp studenter som aldrig haft SOM och endast enstaka AOM episoder. Metoder: Patienter eller deras foraldrar intervjuades och patienternas samtliga journaler, saval fran halsocentraler som fran sjukhuskliniker, rekvirerades. Alla besok noterades tillsammans med uppgifter om oronstatus, AOM, kirurgiska ingrepp, m.m. Uppfoljning av rAOM-barnen gjordes vid 10 ars alder. Uppfoljning av SOM gruppen gjordes i genomsnitt 7 ar efter att vatskan forsvunnit fran mellanorat. Vid uppfoljningen undersoktes trumhinnorna med mikroskop. Horseln testades med ett urval av matmetoder och mellanorats funktion undersoktes. I SOM gruppen testades orontrumpetens funktion i tryckkammare. Resultat: AOM: Upp till skolstarten fortsatte gruppen med frekventa AOM fore 3 ars alder att ha fler AOM, men var for ovrigt inte sjukare an sin ”friska” kontrollgrupp. De flesta hade nagon typ av trumhinneforandring, scleros (arrbildning) var det dominerande fyndet. De barn som fick ror fore 3 ars alder hade mera arr pa sina trumhinnor an de som fick ror forst efter 3 ars alder. AOM gruppen hade samre horsel an kontrollerna i de hogsta frekvenserna (8-16 kHz), men horde lika bra i de lagre frekvenserna (.125-8kHz). De lagre frekvenserna speglar talomradet. AOM gruppen hade mera undertryck i mellanorat och uppvisade en okad rorlighet av trumhinnan. SOM: Patienterna behandlades mellan 6 och 26 ar for SOM. De fick i genomsnitt 7 ror i varje ora, maximala antalet ror var 20 i ett ora. De hade i genomsnitt 78 besok pa ONH-kliniken. De barn som fick sin SOM i anslutning till en AOM episod blev sjuka tidigare i livet an de som inte hade nagon AOM episod fore SOM. I genomsnitt fick gruppen ”rinnande ora” en gang vartannat ar sa lange roren fungerade. Vid uppfoljningen fann vi att de flesta hade nagon form av trumhinneforandring, vanligen tunna och indragna trumhinnor, mindre vanligt med arrbildningar. Enstaka patienter hade opererats for cholesteatom (s.k. parlcysta) och ca 5% av patienterna hade, eller hade opererats p.g.a. hal pa ena trumhinnan. De flesta patienterna hade oronbesvar vid flygning och dykning. Endast vart tredje ora i SOM gruppen hade god funktion av orontrumpeten; i kontrollgruppen hade alla utom en god funktion i bada orontrumpeterna. Majoriteten i SOM gruppen kunde inte, eller endast delvis, utjamna tryckskillnader i mellanorat. Resterande hade en oppetstaende orontrumpet. SOM gruppen horde samre an kontrollgruppen over hela frekvensomradet, dvs aven talomradet. Inga skillnader sags i mellanoretryck och endast delvis i trumhinnans rorlighet. Daremot noterades skillnader i tester som tyder pa skador i innerorat hos SOM gruppen (bl.a. test av horseln nar ljudet leds via skallens ben istallet for via luften). Slutsatser: Upprepade och extremt langdragna oroninflammationer kan ge horselskador. Upprepade AOM ger horselnedsattning i det hogfrekventa horomradet. Langdragen SOM ger horselnedsattning over hela horselomradet, dar orsaken hos en del, men inte alla, finns i innerorat. De flesta som haft langdragna besvar med vatska i mellanorat har svarigheter att tryckutjamna i mellanorat och manga har kvarstaende besvar vid flygning och dykning. (Less)

papers.title: 从男子肾脏“失踪”事件说起
